channel.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
channel.description:
What with this forum slowing down and due to close soon?
I miss story-games.com... :frowning:

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Froggy
item.description:
@Froggy wrote:

So, if anyone‚Äôs still reading this, I‚Äôve launched it (a logo is incoming, but not ready yet). A warning: this is a project I‚Äôve had in mind for a while and it‚Äôs not meant as a replacement for The Gauntlet. It‚Äôs a different place with different goals.

The name of the forum is Wynwerod, an Old English word meaning a wandering troupe of musicians, literally a ‚Äúmerry band‚Äù. I‚Äôm referencing the metaphor, as popularised by Ron Edwards, of the play system as musical instruments, and of the play group as sort of a jam session , with play/music as folk art for mutual enjoyment of the players‚Äîrather than a highly produced or rehearsed piece for an audience. I hope it gives a good impression of the values that I want to impart on this place.

I‚Äôm aware it‚Äôs probably not going to be for everyone. What I‚Äôd like it to be is for anyone that shares its values and goals‚Äîbeyond their personal background or what roleplaying faction they self-identify with. Therefore, let me share with you the Wynwerod agenda .

Agenda

The goals of Wynwerod are:

  • Reflect on and analyse our own role-playing activity, to improve as players, engage authentically, and maximise our enjoyment and sense of purpose.
  • Act as an international cultural crossroads for role-players of any background or nationality.
  • Archive interesting material, or valuable conversations made on more ephemeral platforms.
  • Promote the making of games and play material, with the understanding that games can only get better as a by-product of great play.
  • Discuss to find out what others have to say.

If this interests you, you‚Äôre welcome to make an account and introduce yourself here:

Wynwerod ‚Äî Playing to Play ‚Äì 5 Aug 23

Welcomes and Introductions---Start here! üëã

Welcome to Wynwerod ‚Äî Playing to Play, an international discussion space focused on reflecting on the activity of roleplaying‚Äîbeyond any label or kind of game‚Äîand helping each other engage with it authentically and maximise our enjoyment of this...

Reading time: 4 mins üïë

Read full topic
item.source: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Paul_T
item.description:
@Paul_T wrote:

This seems to be on the roll. Let‚Äôs see if it comes together - spread the word to your friends!

The current idea is to focus on playing on purpose, improving our skills, and collecting the wisdom of the various online spaces where great discussions are happening in one place, where they can be stored indefinitely, linked to, shared, and built upon.

I made a giant summary of PbtA dicing techniques, for example, at La Locanda. I‚Äôll definitely make an English-language version of that for the new forum.

Read full topic
item.source: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Froggy
item.description:
@Froggy wrote:

I‚Äôve been talking with @Paul_T of the possibility that I open an English-language Discourse space myself, inspired by the success of the italian La Locanda dei GDR that I manage.

If I do, though, it‚Äôs not going to be a ‚Äústory games‚Äù forum or a replication of this one ‚Äì on La Locanda I‚Äôve tried to move beyond labels to encourage an eclectic style of play, with cross-pollination from different sources, and that‚Äôs probably the type of space that I‚Äôd want to set up.

If you‚Äôre interested, send me a message, or an email at letsmakeaforum@froggyc.eu, or contact Discord account froggyc.

P.S. I also highly recommend Adept Play if you‚Äôre interested in seriously improving your play. That place has helped me tremendously in the last few years.

Read full topic

item.description:
@dreamup wrote:

Adept Play is still making some efforts in terms of long-form community content. They have actual play posts with comments and the site is paired with a discord server.

Personally, I‚Äôm always on the lookout for places where the conversation is not centered on the D&Ds and I still miss Story Games.

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Rickard
item.description:
@Rickard wrote:

MissAtomicBomb:

Our stance has been that all games where you make fiction are RPGs. Not necessarily in a genre sense, but because we want to embrace games that push the boundaries of the medium.

I don‚Äôt see the use of separating ‚Äútwo‚Äù different play/design styles. They can all fit under the same umbrella.

Read full topic
item.source: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @MissAtomicBomb
item.description:
@MissAtomicBomb wrote:

For me, it‚Äôs an ‚Äúis there interest?‚Äù thing.

Our stance has been that all games where you make fiction are RPGs. Not necessarily in a genre sense, but because we want to embrace games that push the boundaries of the medium.

All that in mind I think we could set up a storygame subforum for communities who need it. The mods and I would have to sort out what goes where, but that‚Äôs not too big a deal.

Like Christopher, I‚Äôm interested in welcoming new designs and experiments. Right now, our game design forum is only lightly populated and designers tend to post their stuff in our Tabletop Roleplaying Open forum. I like that trend, but if we could make the design forum more useful and visible, that would be great, too.

To be a bit blunter and more personal, I‚Äôve lost forums I was a part of, too. Servers are costy and modding is hard.

But I‚Äôve been a poster on RPGnet for more than 20 years, and we have a measure of stability. I‚Äôll gladly offer the benefits of that stability and staying power to anyone here who needs it.

Read full topic
item.source: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Ben_M
item.description:
@Ben_M wrote:

Well, I hardly speak for the community here as a whole () , but I think there are likely a bunch of people here who would be happy to have a forum that is a discussion space for ‚Äústory games‚Äù. Traditionally, story game discussion seems to have worked well when there was a carved-out space of some sort that people felt safe in. What that might look like over at RPGnet is up for debate I suppose? What options would there be at RPGnet? E.g would a subforum be in line with common RPGnet decorum?

Read full topic
item.source: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @MissAtomicBomb
item.description:
@MissAtomicBomb wrote:

Hi! I‚Äôm Rose, RPGnet‚Äôs editor-in-chief and showrunner. Christopher sent this thread to me and we talked it over a little.

I‚Äôm also a designer and publisher, much of it in the indie space.

We‚Äôd be happy to provide a space for Gauntlet posters at RPGnet. What would you folx be interested in having? We mostly don‚Äôt divide forums by genre or topic but if that would help, we can definitely arrange something.

There are no technical issues with accepting new users or adding/modifying subforums. We also share the values of this community.

What do y‚Äôall think, and what do you need?

Read full topic

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Paul_T
item.description:
@Paul_T wrote:

My experience is that there are a lot of places to chat in an ephemeral/social media-style way. Discord servers, Mastodon, even Slack (Paul Beakley‚Äôs Indie RPG Reading Club).

However, forums are wonderful repositories of conversations, links, discussions, and rules, in a way that non-persistent social media can‚Äôt be. So I would really like to have - and to encourage others to contribute to - a forum for people interested in non-mainstream gaming.

Read full topic

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @ChristopherA
item.description:
@ChristopherA wrote:

I own RPGnet, but for some reason discussions on story games and their design never really took off there, and instead emerged in other places. You really can‚Äôt force building a community.

If there was some interest I could revive or repurpose a sub-forum.

‚Äî Christopher Allen

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @SymbolicCity
item.description:
@SymbolicCity wrote:

Consolidating around the Cauldron seems like the best route. And I know that Yochai would be glad to see some fresh energy brought to that place. I wonder if there‚Äôs a way to transfer accounts between Discourse servers, for those who‚Äôd like to make the jump.

Read full topic
item.source: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Ben_M
item.description:
@Ben_M wrote:

I agree about Discord not being the best alternative. I‚Äôm still hoping that we‚Äôll come up with something that allows for longer, preserved discussions too.

I‚Äôm on the [https://discord.com/invite/UUsy6AK](NSR (New-School Revolution) ‚ÄúCauldron‚Äù) and Dungeon World Discord servers, but the fact that there is fragmentation like this is another problem - I have to try to keep up with multiple channels of conversation across multiple servers.

The Cauldron does have a Discourse-based server too: https://discourse.rpgcauldron.com. In theory, people from here could migrate there?

Thanks for the link to the Indie RPG Discord - I‚Äôm going to jump on that too.

Read full topic

item.title: Where are people going for indie RPG / story-game discussion now?
item.dc:creator: @Rickard
item.description:
@Rickard wrote:

Yeah, I miss that too. Closing of that forum and Google+ were huge blows for my story games discussions and relations.

I don‚Äôt understand why people are closing larger story games forums.

https://fictioneers.net/forum started up when Story Games closed, by it died out.

I‚Äôm on the Indie RPG and Randomless Renaissance on Discord, but longer discussions aren‚Äôt really fit for that platform.
